useful_title: What's so Funny? Introduction to Improvisational Comedy
best_comment_short: I have so so much love for improv, for Remo, and for my classmates <3 This is simply one of the best classes I’ve taken at this institution and one I will remember throughout my entire lifetime.

useful_title: Sculpting Activity How Inhibition Shapes the Brain in Health and Disease
best_comment_first: TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU CAN!!
best_comment_short: Saad is SUPER engaging and really facilitates discussion.

best_comment_first: This was the best course I have ever taken at Harvard!
best_comment_short: This was the best course I have ever taken at Harvard!

best_comment_first: THE BEST HARVARD COURSE: Before the class, Public Speaking spawned more anxiety in me than I could reasonably manage, and I was crippled by thoughts about how I sounded or whether people would notice non–existent mannerisms.
best_comment_short: During class sessions, the class can feel like what I imagine a theater class can feel like: fun, varied warm ups,  a spirit of "YES!

best_comment_first: Great course if you are in jazz band – doesn't add a ton of work to your plate and is a good way to learn more about what you are playing within the ensemble.
best_comment_short: Great course if you are in jazz band – doesn't add a ton of work to your plate and is a good way to learn more about what you are playing within the ensemble.
It's such a nurturing learning environment and everyone is so encouraging.
The Slavic Department is incredibly lucky to have her.
Definitely take this course if you want to progress in Hebrew and have a good time.

useful_title: Genre Fiction Workshop Sci-Fi, Fantasy, Speculative Fiction, Horror, The Ghost Story, The New Weird

best_comment_first: I really enjoyed this class because of the course content and classroom community!
best_comment_short: This class is so rewarding and I cannot express in words how amazing it has been and how much I loved it.

useful_title: Interiority & Experience Writing Character-Driven Fiction Workshop
best_comment_first: Professor Messud's courses are terrific fun!
best_comment_short: Workshop courses do require commitment to giving feedback and setting aside time for writing, so make sure you are enthusiastic/ready to give this commitment!

useful_title: Advanced Modern Chinese for High-Proficiency Learners
best_comment_first: Chinese 140XA is a really fun and engaging class!
best_comment_short: Some of the topics can be tricky and hard to understand, but the laoshi's are all super nice and friendly, and it made the trek to Vanserg that much more bearable.

best_comment_first: Don't be intimidated if analysis is a lot at first.
best_comment_short: Make sure you have commentaries so it's easier to dig deeper into Pāninian grammar (what I enjoyed about the analysis process), or just establish a word order so that you can start applying the skills you've learned in intermediate.

useful_title: Advanced Italian I Italian Through Cinema Oral Expression and Performance
best_comment_first: While a lot of work, this class is very rewarding and a lot of fun.
best_comment_short: The Italian classes at Harvard are so well structured and it is always my favorite class on my schedule :) would recommend to anyone

best_comment_first: If you're coming from 130a/b, I really encourage you to take Chinese 140a/b!
best_comment_short: After taking this course, I feel much more confident in tackling nuanced and sensitive topics, since I've learned grammar structures and vocab that can help me express my ideas clearly and elegantly.As for the logistics of the course, the teaching staff are absolutely wonderful as always.
Take it, you'll love it especially as the readings get more interesting and challenging throughout the year.
